hidrocl.products.extractions.mean_datasets(dataset_list)[source]¶

Function to get mean from xarray datasets

Parameters:

dataset_list – list with raster products

Returns:

xarray.Dataset with mean of rasters

hidrocl.products.extractions.mosaic_nd_raster(raster_list, layer1, layer2)[source]¶

Function to compute normalized difference and mosaic files with rioxarray library. The normalized difference is computed as: normalized_difference = 1000 * (layer1 - layer2) / (layer1 + layer2)

Parameters:

  • raster_list – list with raster paths

  • layer1 – str with layer1 to compute normalized difference

  • layer2 – str with layer2 to compute normalized difference

Returns:

rioxarray.Dataset with normalized difference’s mosaic

hidrocl.products.extractions.mosaic_raster(raster_list, layer)[source]¶

Function to compute mosaic files with rioxarray library

Parameters:

  • raster_list – list with raster paths

  • layer – str with layer to extract

Returns:

rioxarray.Dataset with mosaic

hidrocl.products.extractions.sum_datasets(dataset_list)[source]¶

Function to sum xarray datasets

Parameters:

dataset_list – list with raster products

Returns:

xarray.Dataset with sum of rasters

hidrocl.products.extractions.write_line(database, result, catchment_names, file_id, file_date, ncol=1)[source]¶

Write line to database

Parameters:

  • database – str with database path

  • result – pandas.DataFrame with result

  • catchment_names – list with catchment names

  • file_id – str with file ID

  • file_date – str with file date

  • ncol – int with number of column to extract values

Returns:

None

hidrocl.products.extractions.zonal_stats(scene, scenes_path, tempfolder, name, catchment_names, log_file, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function to extract zonal statistics from raster files

Parameters:

  • scene – str with scene name

  • scenes_path – str with scenes path

  • tempfolder – str with temp folder path

  • name – str with product name

  • catchment_names – list with catchment names

  • log_file – str with log file path

  • **kwargs – See below

Keword Arguments:

  • database (str) – Database path

  • pcdatabase (str) – pcdatabase path

  • north_database (str) – North database path

  • south_database (str) – South database path

  • north_pcdatabase (str) – North pcdatabase path

  • south_pcdatabase (str) – South pcdatabase path

  • vector_path: str with vector path

  • north_vector_path: str with north vector path

  • south_vector_path: str with south vector path

  • layer: str or list with layer/layers to extract

Returns:

Print
